meanings.definition: To mark or stripe with a pattern resembling that of a tabby cat.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys tabbying her notebooks with colorful markers.
meanings.sent2: The artist was tabbying the canvas with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The children were tabbying the sidewalk with chalk drawings of cats.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter tabbyed the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sun tabbyed the sky with shades of pink and orange at sunset.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a tabby pattern.
meanings.sent1: Her hobby is tabbying, creating beautiful patterns on fabrics.
meanings.sent2: The tabbying of the curtains added a unique touch to the room.
meanings.sent3: The tabbying competition at the fair was filled with creativity.
meanings.sent4: His music had a tabbying effect on the audience, leaving them mesmerized.
meanings.sent5: The tabbying of the garden with different flowers was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A fabric with a striped or mottled pattern.
meanings.sent1: She wore a lovely tabbying dress to the party.
meanings.sent2: The tabbying of the blanket gave it a cozy and warm look.
meanings.sent3: The tabbying on the sofa made it stand out in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The tabbying of the carpet resembled a field of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The tabbying on the pillow added a pop of color to the room.
